title: Do you think I can run the game with these specs and your thoughts??
body:
CPU:AMD A6-5400k dual core fm2 Overclocked @ 4.0Ghz
Motherboard: Gigabyte FM2A55E33 Micro ATX FM2 Motherboard 
Memory: CRUCIAL 8GB (2 x 4GB) DDR3-1600
Storage: Western Digital Caviar Blue 1TB 3.5" 7200RPM Internal Hard Drive
Video Card: Gigabyte GeForce 750 GTX Ti 2gb GDDR5
PSU: Corsair CX 500W 80+ Bronze Certified Semi-Modular ATX Power Supply

replies.body:
I don' t remember how much that stuff costs, but i would never overclock with only a bronze corsair...
also, it' s me or the processor is underwhelming compared to the graphic card? O_O
however it is more than fine
do you think i should get a better cpu than??

Normally i would advise not, since games mostly rely on the GPU, but... hell, you have a graphic card better than my actual pc, and a processor similar to my old 2003 pc! :O

I don' t know what to say, probly it will be bottlenecked probably not. When you or who ever did this pc picked up the parts, it was considered that not enough cpu power can' t use properly all the gpu?

I looked at recommended specs, and looks you will be fine. So atm better not change anything if you already bought it. Else get at least a 6-core, from amd there is one really cheap, without too much electric drain and well performing ( but is a 6 core... they have a bit of stigma ). In doubt, go for what you posted.

I'm sure it is bottlenecked because I have problems running the game running it only at 60-70 frames avg on very high sometimes I have to put it at medium to get 80avg steady but I have a Fm2 Socket so that limited me
I might change out my cpu to a a6 7400k

Your CPU is clocked higher, and you have more RAM than me. I have the same GPU and I'm playing above 200FPS. Also: Overclock the hell out of that card, it'll take it. I'm on the reference card +220 core and +350 memory. Noticeable increases in more intensive games (got like a 10-15 boost in Skyrim).
how are you playing above 200fps im playing 40-60fps avg Very high Anti-Aliasing On abnd what program do you use?

Similar to my system, except my processor is a bit better.  

I run 200+ fps

Hey Shuyeong!

You should definitely be able to run the game with these specs, as they are way over our [Minimum Specs for League of Legends](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654-Minimum-and-Recommended-System-Requirements).  It's almost impossible to say at what settings/FPS LoL will be run at, but you should have no problem starting up and playing.
